description.narrative:
Support growth of more efficient healthcare supply chains. Demand for affordable healthcare services in Asia is growing fast. Better supply chain performance will reduce cost, lead time and obsolescence and improve accessibility to markets, especially for smaller hospitals located away from major urban centers.
Expand awareness of best practices in supply chain management in the region. McKinsey & Co. estimates that supply chain expenses represent 25% of pharma and more than 40% of medical device costs. By adopting best practices from industries with more mature supply chains, the healthcare sector has the potential to significantly expand margins. Support knowledge sharing and capacity building in the healthcare industry. As a distributor for many of the leading global healthcare suppliers, IDS Medical plays an important role in sharing updates on new products and technologies with its network of 10,000 customers. IDS Medical also provides training to its customers' staff on new products and equipment. This is especially important for the smaller hospitals in its network.
